source_sentence: 爾時，眾中天帝釋等，欲界諸天大梵王等，色界諸天及餘神仙，歡喜踊躍，同時三返高聲唱言：「奇哉！
translation: At that point, a multitude of gods such as Indra and the others, gods of the desire realm such as Brahmā, gods of the form realm, and other sages rejoiced and jumped for joy as they all returned three times and shouted, "Amazing!

source_sentence: 奇哉！
translation: Amazing!

source_sentence: 法性深妙。
translation: The nature of the Dharma is profound and subtle.

source_sentence: 如來出世以神通力加善現等宣說開示，若諸菩薩不離般若波羅蜜多，我等於彼恭敬供養如佛世尊。」
translation: When the Tathāgata appears in the world, he uses his supernormal powers to explain and reveal to us that if bodhisattvas don't part from the perfection of wisdom, we will respect and make offerings to them like the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸天等言：「如是！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the gods and so forth, saying, "So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 若諸菩薩不離般若波羅蜜多，汝諸天等皆應供養如佛世尊。
translation: If bodhisattvas don't part with the perfection of wisdom, you gods and goddesses should all make offerings to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 「天等當知！
translation: "Gods, you should know!

source_sentence: 我於往昔然燈佛時，蓮花王都四衢道首見然燈佛，獻五莖花，布髮掩泥聞正法要，不離般若波羅蜜多。
translation: In the past, when Randana Buddha was born, the lotus king met Randana Buddha at the head of the four roads, offered him five flowers, spread his hair and covered his mud, and heard the essentials of the right teaching, which was not free from the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 時，彼如來與我受記：『汝於來世過無數劫，當成如來，號為能寂，宣說般若波羅蜜多與諸有情作大饒益。』」
translation: That Tathāgata then gave me this assurance: 'In a future life that will last for countless eons, you will become a Tathāgata, be called Nengjian, and teach the perfection of wisdom to bring great benefit to sentient beings.'"

source_sentence: 時，諸天等俱白佛言：「甚奇！
translation: The gods and others then said to the Buddha, "How marvelous!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 希有！
translation: I wish I had!

source_sentence: 善逝！
translation: Well gone!

source_sentence: 如是般若波羅蜜多具大威神，令諸菩薩速能引攝一切智智。」
translation: Such prajñāpāramitā has great authority and power, which quickly enables bodhisattvas to bring together the wisdom of all knowables."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知諸天等四眾雲集同為明證，即便顧命天帝釋言：「憍尸迦！
translation: Knowing that the four crowds of gods and others had gathered together to clearly witness this, the Bhagavān then instructed Śakra to say, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等能於般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，或復為他書寫、解說，魔及眷屬、人非人等伺求其短終不能得，災橫疾疫皆不能害。
translation: If good men and good women wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate the perfection of wisdom, or if they even write or explain it for others, Māra, his retinue, humans and non-humans will never be able to get the short end of it, and neither calamity nor epidemic will harm them.

source_sentence: 若諸天子已發無上正等覺心，未善聽聞、受持、讀誦甚深般若波羅蜜多，皆應來至是善男子、善女人所，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦，令極通利轉為他說。
translation: If gods and goddesses have arisen the mind of unsurpassed correct enlightenment but haven't yet well heard, accepted, and recited the profound prajñāpāramitā, they should come to these good men and good women and wholeheartedly hear, accept, and recite it, so that it's perfectly understandable and can be taught to others.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等能於般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，或復為他書寫、解說，若在空宅、曠野、險道及危難處，諸天善神常來擁護令無驚恐。」
translation: If good sons and good women wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate the perfection of wisdom, or if they write and explain it for others, the gods and good spirits will always come to support them and prevent them from becoming frightened if they are in an empty house, a wilderness, a dangerous path, or a place of danger."

source_sentence: 時，四天王及天帝釋、梵天王等，合掌恭敬俱白佛言：「若善男子、善女人等能於般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，或復為他書寫、解說，我等眷屬常隨守護，不令一切災橫侵惱。」
translation: The four heavenly kings, Śakra Devānām-Indra, and the Brahma Heavenly Kings then joined their palms in respect and said to the Buddha, "If good sons and good women wholeheartedly hear and retain the prajñāpāramitā, recite it, diligently cultivate it, and correctly contemplate it, or if they also write and explain it to others, our followers will always be there to guard it and prevent all calamities from befalling them."

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋復白佛言：「甚奇！
translation: Then, Śakra again said to the Buddha, "How marvelous!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 希有！
translation: I wish I had!

source_sentence: 善逝！
translation: Well gone!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等奉事般若波羅蜜多，攝受如是現法功德。
translation: These are good men and good women who serve the perfection of wisdom and gather the merits of such a manifestation.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等攝受般若波羅蜜多，則具攝受布施、淨戒、安忍、精進、靜慮、般若波羅蜜多。」
translation: If good men and good women assimilate the perfection of wisdom, then they will have assimilated the perfections of generosity, pure morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告天帝釋言：「如是！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra, saying, "So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 如汝所說。
translation: Just as you said.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等能於般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，或復為他書寫、解說，所獲功德，汝應諦聽，極善作意！
translation: If good men and good women wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate the perfection of wisdom, or if they write or explain it for others, the merit they will attain should you listen closely and give it your best attention!

source_sentence: 當為汝說。」
translation: I will explain this for you."

source_sentence: 天帝釋言：「唯然！
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said, "Yes!

source_sentence: 願說！
translation: vow to speak!

source_sentence: 我等樂聞。」
translation: We're happy to hear about it."

source_sentence: 佛言：「憍尸迦！
translation: The Buddha said, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若有諸惡外道梵志，若諸惡魔或魔眷屬，若餘暴惡增上慢者，欲作種種不饒益事，彼適興心自遭殃禍，漸當殄滅不果所願。
translation: If there are evil non-Buddhist priests, evil demons or their followers, or other violent and arrogant people who want to do various unbeneficial things, their improperly motivated thoughts will bring misfortune on themselves, and gradually they'll be destroyed without fulfilling their wishes.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等能於般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，或復為他書寫、解說，法爾能令起惡心者自遭殃禍不果所願。
translation: If these good men and women wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate the perfection of wisdom, or if they write or explain it for others, it will cause those who give rise to evil thoughts to suffer misfortune and not fulfill their wishes.

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等奉事般若波羅蜜多，獲如是等功德勝利。
translation: "Good men and good women who serve the perfection of wisdom will attain such merits and rewards.

source_sentence: 如有妙藥名曰莫耆，是藥威勢能銷眾毒，如是妙藥隨所在處，諸毒蟲類不能逼近。
translation: Suppose there's a wonderful medicine called mojito, which has the power to slay many poisons, and wherever such a wonderful medicine is found, poisonous insects and worms can't get close to it.

source_sentence: 有大毒蛇饑行求食，遇見生類欲螫噉之，其生怖死奔趣妙藥，蛇聞藥氣尋便退走。
translation: When a large venomous snake travels hungry for food and meets a living creature that wants to sting and bite it, the creature runs to the wonderful medicine in fear of death, and the snake retreats when it hears the medicine's odor.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 如是妙藥具大威勢，能益身命銷伏眾毒。
translation: "Thus, this wonderful medicine has great authority, and it's able to improve body and life and quell numerous poisons.

source_sentence: 當知般若波羅蜜多具大威勢亦復如是，若善男子、善女人等，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，或復為他書寫、解說，諸惡人等欲於其所作不饒益，必當殄滅無所能為，般若威神能摧彼故。
translation: You should know that the great authority of the perfection of wisdom is likewise, for if good men and good women wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate it, or if they write or explain it for others, those bad people who want to do something unbeneficial to them will surely be destroyed and become incapable of doing it, because the mighty power of prajñā can destroy them.

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，四大天王及餘天眾并諸神仙常來擁護，不令一切災橫侵惱，諸佛、菩薩亦常護念，如法所求無不滿足，言詞威肅聞皆敬受，發言稱量語不喧雜，堅事善友深知恩報，不為慳嫉、忿恨、覆惱、諂、誑、矯等隱蔽其心。
translation: "Good sons and good women, the four heavenly kings, the other celestials, and the sages always come to guard them, prevent all calamities from befalling them, always guard the buddhas and bodhisattvas, seek nothing according to the teaching, speak respectfully and respectfully, speak in a measured way without clamoring, serve good friends deeply, and know the rewards of kindness, and don't let stinginess, jealousy, hostility, overburdening, flattery, deceit, and coercion conceal their minds.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等般若威力調伏身心，令其遠離貪、瞋、癡等隨眠、纏、結。
translation: "Good men and good women, the power of prajñā regulates body and mind, freeing them from the latent tendencies, entanglements, and bonds of greed, anger, and delusion.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等具念正知慈、悲、喜、捨，常作是念：『我不應隨慳貪、破戒、忿恚、懈怠、散亂、愚癡勢力而轉，若隨彼轉，則我布施、淨戒、安忍、精進、靜慮、妙慧不成，嚴淨色身尚不能得，況得無上正等菩提！
translation: Those good sons and good women are fully mindful of the correct knowledge of kindness, pity, joy, and equanimity, and they always think, 'I shouldn't be led around by the power of stinginess, greed, broken precepts, anger, laziness, dissipation, and foolishness; if I were led around by those forces, then my generosity, pure precepts, patience, effort, meditation, and subtle wisdom wouldn't be attained, and I wouldn't yet be able to attain the perfectly pure physical body, so how could I attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?'

source_sentence: 故我不應隨彼力轉。』
translation: I therefore shouldn't follow their power.'

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等由此思惟常得正念，諸惡煩惱不蔽其心。
translation: Good men and good women, this reflection always produces right mindfulness, and bad afflictions don't obscure their minds.

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等能於般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，或復為他書寫、解說，獲如是等功德勝利。」
translation: If good sons and good women wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate the perfection of wisdom, or if they even write or explain it for others, they'll attain such merits and benefits."

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋復白佛言：「如是般若波羅蜜多甚為希有，能調菩薩令離高心，迴向所求一切智智。」
translation: Śāriputra then again said to the Buddha, "Such prajñāpāramitā is rare and can condition a bodhisattva to part with his high mind and turn toward the wisdom of all that he seeks."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告天帝釋言：「云何般若波羅蜜多甚為希有，能調菩薩令離高心，迴向所求一切智智？」
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra, "How is the prajñāpāramitā so rare that it can tame a bodhisattva into parting with his high mind and turning toward the wisdom of all that he seeks?"

source_sentence: 天帝釋言：「若諸菩薩不依般若波羅蜜多，無方便善巧故，雖修諸善而起高心，不能迴求一切智智；若諸菩薩能依般若波羅蜜多，有方便善巧故，所修諸善能伏高心，迴向所求一切智智。」
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said, "If bodhisattvas don't rely on the perfection of wisdom and don't have skillful means, then even though they cultivate good qualities and become highly motivated, they won't be able to turn around and seek knowledge of all things; if bodhisattvas can rely on the perfection of wisdom and have skillful means, the good qualities they cultivate will subdue their high minds and lead them to the knowledge of all things they seek."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告天帝釋言：「如是！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra, "So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 如汝所說。
translation: As you say.

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等能於般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦，不為一切災橫侵惱。
translation: "If good men and good women wholeheartedly hear, retain, and recite the perfection of wisdom, they won't be afflicted by any calamity.

source_sentence: 若在軍旅交戰陣時，至心念誦如是般若波羅蜜多，於諸有情慈悲護念，不為刀仗之所傷殺，所對怨敵皆起慈心，設起惡心自然退敗。
translation: If they wholeheartedly recite the perfection of wisdom when engaged in battle, they'll be compassionate and watchful toward sentient beings, won't be wounded or killed by swords or battles, and will become compassionate toward their enemies, so that if they give rise to bad thoughts, they'll naturally retreat and lose.

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，若在軍陣刀箭所傷失命喪身，終無是處。
translation: Good men and good women who are wounded by swords and arrows in battle and lose their lives and bodies will never find a place to go.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 如是般若波羅蜜多是大神呪、是無上呪，若能於此精勤修學，不為自害、不為他害、不為俱害，疾證無上正等菩提。
translation: Thus, prajñāpāramitā is a great incantation and a peerless dhāraṇī, and if you diligently train in it, you won't harm yourself, harm others, or harm both, and you'll quickly realize unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 由斯獲得一切智智，觀有情類心行差別，隨宜為轉無上法輪，令如說行得大饒益。
translation: As a result, they'll attain omniscience, observe the distinctions in the minds and actions of sentient beings, and appropriately turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma for them, causing their practices to be carried out as described to be of great benefit.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等書此般若波羅蜜多，置清淨處供養恭敬，或復精勤受持、讀誦，人非人等欲求其短終不能得，唯除宿世惡業應受。
translation: If good men and good women write this perfection of wisdom and place it in a pure place to offer support and respect, or if they diligently maintain it and recite it, the shortcomings of what humans and non-humans want will never be obtained, except for the bad karma of prior lives that should be received.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 譬如有人或傍生類，入菩提樹院或至彼院邊，人非人等不能傷害。
translation: "Suppose a person or a group of animals enters the courtyard of a bodhi tree or goes to its edge, and neither humans nor non-humans can harm them.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 三世諸佛皆坐此處得大菩提，施諸有情無恐、無怖、無怨、無害身心安樂。
translation: The buddhas of the three times all sit here and attain great enlightenment, bestowing on sentient beings fearlessness, fearlessness, hostility, and harmlessness and physical and mental well-being.

source_sentence: 當知般若波羅蜜多隨所住處亦復如是，一切天、龍、阿素洛等常來守護。
translation: You should know that this is likewise the place where Prajñāpāramitā follows and where all gods, dragons, asuras, and so forth always come to guard.

source_sentence: 當知是處即真制多，一切有情皆應敬禮，恭敬供養、尊重讚歎不應暫捨。
translation: Knowing that this place is truly the abode of the perfection of control, all sentient beings should venerate it, respectfully offer support, and venerate and praise it, and they shouldn't abandon it for a moment.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是諸有情歸依處故。」
translation: This is the place to which all sentient beings must turn."

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋復白佛言：「若善男子、善女人等書此般若波羅蜜多，種種莊嚴供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，復以種種上妙花鬘乃至燈明而為供養。
translation: Śakra then said to the Buddha, "Suppose good sons and good women write this prajñāpāramitā, present it with various adornments, offer it with respect and admiration, and make offerings with various kinds of beautiful flowers and even lamps.

source_sentence: 有善男子、善女人等佛涅槃後起窣堵波七寶嚴飾，寶函盛貯佛設利羅安置其中，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，復以種種上妙花鬘乃至燈明而為供養。
translation: After the Buddha's nirvāṇa, some good sons and good women erect a stūpa adorned with seven treasures, store a treasure box full of the Buddha's śarīra, place it there, offer it with respect, honor, and praise it, and then make offerings with a variety of beautiful flower garlands and even lamps.

source_sentence: 二所獲福，何者為多？」
translation: Which of these two kinds of merit is greater?"

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告天帝釋言：「我還問汝，當隨意答。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakra, saying, "I'll ask you again, and you'll answer as you like.

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 如來所得一切智智，所證無上正等菩提及所依身，依何等道修學而得？」
translation: What path does the Tathāgata attain, based on the cultivation of omniscience, the unsurpassed correct enlightenment that he realizes, and the body on which he relies?"

source_sentence: 天帝釋言：「皆依般若波羅蜜多修學而得。」
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said, "They all attain it by cultivating the perfection of wisdom."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告天帝釋言：「如是！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra, saying, "So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 如汝所說。
translation: As you said.

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 非但獲得相好身故說名如來、應、正等覺，要由證得一切智智乃名如來、應、正等覺。
translation: It's not just that they're called tathāgatas, arhats, and fully enlightened because they've attained the body of good features; they're called tathāgatas, arhats, and fully enlightened because they've realized the wisdom of omniscience.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 如來所得一切智智，要由般若波羅蜜多為因故起，佛相好身但為依處，若不依止佛相好身無由而起，是故般若波羅蜜多，正為因生一切智智，欲令此智現前相續故，復修集佛相好身。
translation: The Tathāgata's attainment of omniscience arises only because prajñā-pāramitā is the cause, and the Buddha's attractive body is merely a support; if it doesn't rely on the Buddha's attractive body, there's no way it can arise; therefore, prajñ-pāramitā is precisely the cause for the arising of omniscience, and in order to make this knowledge manifest in a continuous way, I further cultivate the Buddha's attractive body.

translation: "Among the countless and limitless varieties of sentient beings who arouse the mind of enlightenment, some one, some two, and some three attain the stage of nonretrogression as bodhisattvas, while many others retrogress to the stage of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas.

translation: If good sons and good women can write the prajñāpāramitā, adorned with many treasures, receive and recite it, carry a variety of wonderful flower garlands and even lamps, make offerings, venerate, respect, and praise it, the merit they will attain will be one hundred times greater than the previous stūpa and offerings, one thousand times greater, and even up to the upāniyas and dharmas will be greater still."

translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 依深般若波羅蜜多大神呪王，世間便有菩薩出現；依菩薩故，世間便有十善業道、若四靜慮、若四無量、若四無色定、若五神通，若餘無量無邊佛法皆得出現。
translation: Relying on the great Dhāraṇī King of profound prajñāpāramitā, bodhisattvas appear in the world, and because of bodhisattvas, the ten good karmic paths, the four meditations, the four immeasurables, the four formless concentrations, the five supernormal powers, and the other measureless and limitless Buddha-teachings all appear in the world.

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若諸如來、應、正等覺不出世時，唯有菩薩，由先所聞甚深般若波羅蜜多增上勢力，為諸有情方便施設十善業道、四靜慮等令勤修學。
translation: When the Tathāgatas, Arhats, and Fully Awakened Ones don't appear in the world, there are only bodhisattvas who, because of the profound prajñāpāramitā they've heard about in the past, have the power to intensify their efforts to cultivate the ten good actions and the four meditations for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 譬如夜分，因滿月輪光明照觸，星宿、藥等隨其勢力皆得增盛，如是如來、應、正等覺前已滅度，正法隱沒後未出時，世間所有善行、正行，一切皆依菩薩出現。
translation: For example, at the nighttime divisions, when the full moon shines brightly, the stars and medicines that follow its power all become abundant, and so the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One had previously ceased and the right Dharma hadn't yet emerged after being withdrawn, all the good and right practices in the world relied on the bodhisattva to appear.

source_sentence: 菩薩所有方便善巧，皆依般若波羅蜜多而得成辦，是故般若波羅蜜多是諸殊勝善法根本。
translation: All of the bodhisattvas' skillful means and skillful means were accomplished based on the perfection of wisdom, so the perfection of wisdom was the root of all excellent good qualities.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等能於般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦，當得現世種種饒益，謂諸毒藥、水火、刀兵、災橫、疾疫皆不能害。
translation: "If good men and good women wholeheartedly hear, retain, and recite the perfection of wisdom, they'll attain a variety of benefits in the present life, meaning that poison, water and fire, swords and armies, disasters, and epidemics won't harm them.

source_sentence: 若遭官事怨賊逼迫，至心誦念甚深般若波羅蜜多，若至其所終不為彼譴罰加害，欲求其短皆不能得。
translation: If they're persecuted by officials or enemies, and they wholeheartedly recite the profound prajñāpāramitā, they'll never be punished or harmed by them if they go to their place, and their shortcomings won't be met if they want them to.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 甚深般若波羅蜜多，威神勢力法令爾故。
translation: "Because of the profound prajñāpāramitā, this is accomplished by authoritative power.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，若有欲至國王、王子、大臣等處，至心誦念甚深般若波羅蜜多，定為王等歡喜問訊、供養恭敬、尊重讚歎。
translation: "Good men and good women, if you want to go to a king, prince, minister, or other place and wholeheartedly recite the profound perfection of wisdom, you will surely be greeted joyfully by the king and others, offered support and respect, and praised with respect.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 甚深般若波羅蜜多，常於有情引發種種慈悲事故，由此因緣，諸求短者種種方便皆不能得。」
translation: The profound perfection of wisdom always produces various compassionate events for sentient beings, and as a result, those who seek shortage are unable to attain them with various means."

source_sentence: 時，有眾多外道梵志欲求佛過來詣佛所。
translation: At the time, there were many non-Buddhist priests who wanted to see the Buddha and came to visit him.

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋見已念言：「今此眾多外道梵志，來趣法會伺求佛短，將非般若留難事耶？
translation: When the god Śakra saw this, he thought, "Wouldn't this multitude of non-Buddhist priests who have come to the Dharma assembly to pursue the shortage of the Buddha be a difficult task for Prajñāparamitra?

source_sentence: 我當誦念從佛所受甚深般若波羅蜜多，令彼邪徒復道而去。」
translation: I will recite the recitation of the profound prajñā-pāramitā that I received from the Buddha, so that those evil people will resume their paths and leave."

source_sentence: 念已便誦甚深般若波羅蜜多，於是眾多外道梵志遙申敬禮，右繞世尊復道而去。
translation: After reciting this, he then recited the transcendent prajñāpāramitā, and that large group of non-Buddhist priests paid homage to the Bhagavān, circled to his right, resumed their path, and departed.

source_sentence: 時，舍利子見已念言：「彼有何緣適來還去？」
translation: When Śāriputra saw this, he thought, "What are the reasons why they've come and gone?"

source_sentence: 佛知其意，告舍利子：「彼諸外道來求我失，由天帝釋誦念般若波羅蜜多令彼還去。
translation: Knowing what he meant, the Buddha told Śāriputra, "Those non-Buddhists who came to seek my loss were made to return by the god Śakra's recitation of the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 舍利子！
translation: Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 我都不見彼諸外道有少白法，唯懷惡心為求我過來至我所。
translation: I don't even see those non-Buddhists who have a little white dharma and only have bad intentions about coming to me.

source_sentence: 舍利子！
translation: Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 我都不見一切世間有諸天魔及外道等有情之類，說般若時懷勃惡心來求得便，般若威力無能壞故。」
translation: I don't see any gods, Māra, non-Buddhists, or other sentient beings in the world who come seeking an advantage with a harsh mind when they teach prajñā, because prajñā's power can't destroy them."

source_sentence: 爾時，惡魔竊作是念：「今佛四眾恭敬圍繞，欲、色界天皆來集會，宣說般若波羅蜜多。
translation: At the time, the demons secretly thought, "Now, the Buddha is surrounded by four groups of people who respect him, and the gods of the desire realm and form realm have all come to assemble and preach the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 此中必有諸大菩薩，親於佛前受菩提記，當得無上正等菩提，轉妙法輪空我境界，我當往至破壞其眼。」
translation: There must be some great bodhisattvas here who have personally received the assurance of enlightenment before the Buddha and will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and turn the wonderful Dharma wheel into the realm of emptiness and self, so I will go there and destroy their eyes."

source_sentence: 作是念已，化作四軍奮威勇銳來詣佛所。
translation: After he had this thought, he transformed into four armies that rallied with authority and courage and came to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋見已念言：「將非惡魔化作斯事，欲來惱佛并與般若波羅蜜多而作留難。
translation: When he saw them, Indra thought, "Wouldn't this be something that Māra would do in order to annoy the Buddha and make things difficult for him and the Prajñāparamitā?

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如是四軍嚴飾殊麗，諸王軍眾皆不能及，定是惡魔之所化作。
translation: These four armies are so ornately decorated and beautiful that the king's army couldn't match them, but they must be the work of a bad demon.

source_sentence: 惡魔長夜伺求佛短，壞諸有情所修善業，我當誦念從佛所受甚深般若波羅蜜多，令彼惡魔復道而去。」
translation: For a long time, that evil demon has been longing for the shortcomings of the Buddha and has destroyed the good actions cultivated by sentient beings. I will recite the recitation of the profound prajñāpāramitā that I received from the Buddha, so that that evil demon will return to the path and leave."

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋念已便誦甚深般若波羅蜜多，於是惡魔漸退而去，甚深般若波羅蜜多大神呪王威力逼故。
translation: After he recited that thought, Śakra then recited the Vātsīpa-prajñāpāramitā, and the evil demon gradually retreated and left, being forced to do so by the mighty power of the Vātsīpa-prajñāpāramitā great incantation king.

source_sentence: 時，有無量三十三天俱時化作天妙音華，踊身空中而散佛上，合掌恭敬同白佛言：「願此般若波羅蜜多在贍部洲人中久住，乃至般若波羅蜜多在贍部洲人間流布。
translation: At the time, an incalculable number of Trāyastriṃśa gods simultaneously transformed into divine flowers of sound, rose up in the air, scattered over the Buddha, joined their palms in respect, and together said to the Buddha, "May this prajñāpāramitā be long-lasting among the people of Jambudvīpa, even as prajñāpāramitā spreads among the people of Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 當知是處佛、法、僧寶常不滅沒，饒益世間令獲殊勝利益安樂。」
translation: You should know that this is a place where the buddhas, Dharma, and saṃgha treasures never perish and enrich the world to obtain excellent benefits and well-being."

source_sentence: 時，彼諸天復各化作天妙音華而散佛上，重白佛言：「若諸有情修行般若波羅蜜多，一切惡魔及彼眷屬伺求其短不能得便。」
translation: The gods then each transformed themselves into a heavenly, marvelous-sounding flower and scattered it on top of the Buddha, repeating to him, "If sentient beings cultivate the perfection of wisdom, all the evil demons and their retinues who seek their shortcomings won't be able to get an advantage over them."

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋便白佛言：「若諸有情但聞般若波羅蜜多功德名字，當知如是諸有情類，已曾供養無量諸佛，於諸佛所發弘誓願，多集善根能成是事，非從少小善根中來，況能聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，轉為有情書寫、解說，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎！
translation: Tendai then said to the Buddha, "If sentient beings only hear the name of the merit of prajñāpāramitā, they should know that such sentient beings have made offerings to measureless buddhas, made great vows to the buddhas, and have gathered many good roots to accomplish this task, not from a few small good roots, let alone being able to hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate it, and then write and explain it for sentient beings, offering them respect, veneration, and praise!

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: What is the reason?

source_sentence: 欲求諸佛一切智智，應於般若波羅蜜多理趣中求，如有情類欲求大寶，應於大海方便勤求。」
translation: Those who want to pursue the buddhas' omniscience should pursue it in the doctrinal path of the perfection of wisdom, just as sentient beings who want to pursue great treasures should diligently pursue them in the ocean of skillful means."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告天帝釋言：「如是！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra, saying, "So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 如汝所說。
translation: As you've said.

source_sentence: 諸佛所得一切智智，皆依般若波羅蜜多而得成辦。」
translation: All the wisdom that buddhas attain is based on the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, and it comes to pass."

source_sentence: 爾時，慶喜便白佛言：「如來何緣不讚布施乃至靜慮波羅蜜多，唯讚般若波羅蜜多？」
translation: It was then that Revelation then said to the Buddha, "Why doesn't the Tathāgata praise the perfection of generosity and even the perfection of meditation, but only the perfection of wisdom?"

source_sentence: 佛告慶喜：「由此般若波羅蜜多能與前五波羅蜜多為尊為導，故我偏讚。
translation: The Buddha told Heiji, "Thus, the perfection of wisdom is as honored and guided as the previous five perfections, so I give it partial praise.

source_sentence: 「復次，慶喜！
translation: "Furthermore, Reiji!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 若不迴向一切智智，而修布施乃至般若，此可名為真修布施乃至般若波羅蜜多不？」
translation: If someone cultivates generosity and even prajñā without dedicating themselves to omniscience, can this be called truly cultivating generosity and even prajñāpāramitā?"

source_sentence: 慶喜對曰：「不也！
translation: He said, "No!

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛告慶喜：「於意云何？
translation: The Buddha told Śrī Siṃha, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 若離般若波羅蜜多為能真迴向一切智智不？」
translation: If we part with the perfection of wisdom, can we truly dedicate ourselves to the knowledge of all things?"

source_sentence: 慶喜對曰：「不也！
translation: He said, "No!

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛告慶喜：「由此因緣，我說般若波羅蜜多能與前五波羅蜜多為尊為導，故我偏讚。
translation: The Buddha told Hei Hei, "Because of this, I say that the perfection of wisdom is as honored and guided as the first five perfections, so I give it partial praise.

source_sentence: 「慶喜當知！
translation: "You should know, Kōkai!

source_sentence: 譬如大地以種散中，眾緣和合便得生長，應知大地與種生長，為所依止、為能建立。
translation: "It's like when the earth is scattered with seeds, but when many conditions combine, it grows, so you should know that the earth and the seeds that grow are what's supported and what can be built.

source_sentence: 如是般若波羅蜜多及所迴向一切智智，與布施等波羅蜜多，為所依止、為能建立，令得生長故，說般若波羅蜜多能與前五波羅蜜多為尊為導，故我偏讚。
translation: Thus, because the perfection of wisdom, the omniscience that's directed toward, and the perfection of generosity are both supported and established, and cause growth, it's said that the perfection of wisdom is both honored and guided by the first five perfections, so I'm inclined to praise them.

source_sentence: 慶喜當知！
translation: You should know this, Rejoice!

source_sentence: 甚深般若波羅蜜多亦能攝受一切智智，故偏讚說。」
translation: The profound prajñāpāramitā can also embrace omniscience, so it's praised in part."

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋便白佛言：「今者如來、應、正等覺，於深般若波羅蜜多功德勝利說猶未盡。
translation: Tendai then said to the Buddha, "Now, the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, and the Perfectly Enlightened One have yet to explain the profound prajñāpāramitā's merits and benefits.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我從世尊所受般若波羅蜜多功德勝利甚深、甚廣、量無邊際。
translation: The merits and benefits of the prajñāpāramitā that I received from the Bhagavān are deep, vast, and limitless in number.

source_sentence: 善男子等於深般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，復轉為他書寫、解說，或持種種上妙花鬘乃至燈明而為供養，所獲功德亦無邊際。」
translation: Good sons, when we wholeheartedly hear and retain the profound prajñāpāramitā, recite it, diligently cultivate it, and correctly contemplate it, we also write and explain it for others, or we carry and make offerings of various wonderful flowers and even lamps, and the merit we obtain knows no limit."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告天帝釋言：「我不說此甚深般若波羅蜜多但有前說功德勝利，甚深般若波羅蜜多具足無邊功德勝利，分別演說不可盡故。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra, "I don't say that this profound prajñāpāramitā has only the merits and benefits previously explained, but the profound prajñāpāramitā is full of limitless merits and benefits that cannot be exhausted because it's been discerned and explained.

source_sentence: 我亦不說於深般若波羅蜜多至心聽聞乃至供養，善男子等但有如前所說功德，彼所獲福無邊際故。」
translation: I also don't explain that the profound prajñāpāramitā is something that good sons and others hear with utmost care and make offerings to, but only has the merits as explained before, so the fortune they obtain has no limit."

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋即白佛言：「我等諸天常隨守護是善男子、善女人等，不令一切人非人等種種惡緣之所損害。」
translation: Thereupon, Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the Buddha, "We gods will always guard these good sons and good women from all kinds of bad causes, both human and non-human."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告天帝釋言：「若善男子、善女人等，受持、讀誦甚深般若波羅蜜多，及廣為他宣說開示。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra, saying, "Suppose good sons and good women were to memorize and recite the profound prajñāpāramitā and widely explain and instruct it for others.

source_sentence: 時，有無量百千天子，為聽法故皆來集會，歡喜踊躍敬受如是甚深般若波羅蜜多。
translation: At the time, measureless hundreds of thousands of celestials gathered here to listen to the teaching, rejoicing and jumping for joy as they venerated such a profound prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 是諸天子以天威力，令說法師增益辯才宣揚無盡，不樂說者令其樂說，身心疲極令得康強。
translation: With the power of the gods, these sons of gods cause their Dharma preachers to increase their eloquence and proclaim it endlessly, making those who don't like to preach happy to preach and making them strong from physical and mental exhaustion.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，受持、讀誦甚深般若波羅蜜多，及廣為他宣說開示，得如是等現法勝利。
translation: These good men and good women who retain and recite the profound perfection of wisdom and who teach and reveal it to others will attain such surpassing benefits in the present life.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等，於四眾中宣說如是甚深般若波羅蜜多，心無怯怖，不為一切論難所伏。
translation: "If good men and good women explain such a profound prajñāpāramitā among the four groups of people, their minds aren't frightened, and they aren't stifled by all the difficulties in the debate.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼由如是甚深般若波羅蜜多大神呪王所護持故，彼住法空都不見有能難、所難及所說故，亦不見有於深般若波羅蜜多能求短故，亦復不見甚深般若波羅蜜多有過失故。
translation: Because they are thus protected by the great incantation king of the profound prajñāpāramitā, they don't see anything that's difficult, that's difficult, or that's explained when they abide in the emptiness of things, don't see anything short of the profound prajñāpāramitā, and don't see any faults with the profound prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，為眾宣說甚深般若波羅蜜多，得如是等現法勝利。
translation: These are good men and good women who teach the profound perfection of wisdom to others and attain such surpassing benefits in the present life.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等於深般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，及廣為他書寫、解說，是善男子、善女人等，心不沈沒亦不憂悔、不恐、不怖。
translation: "If good men and good women wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate the profound perfection of wisdom, and if they widely write and explain it for others, good men and good women will not be submerged in thought or regret, nor will they be afraid or terrified.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，不見有法可令沈沒、憂悔、恐怖，於諸法中無所執著。
translation: "Good men and good women who don't see things that cause sinking, regret, and fear have no attachment to any of these things.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，由於般若波羅蜜多至心聽聞乃至解說，得如是等現法勝利。
translation: Because these good men and good women wholeheartedly hear and explain the perfection of wisdom, they'll attain such surpassing benefits in the present life.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等能於般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，亦轉為他書寫、解說，復持種種上妙花鬘乃至燈明而為供養，是善男子、善女人等，恒為父母、師長、親友、國王、大臣及諸沙門、婆羅門等之所敬愛，亦為十方諸佛、菩薩、聲聞、獨覺之所護念，復為世間諸天、魔、梵、人及非人之所守衛，一切災橫皆自消滅，外道異論皆不能伏。
translation: If good sons and good women wholeheartedly hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate the perfection of wisdom, write and explain it for others, and carry various kinds of wonderful flowers, garlands, and even lamps as offerings, such good sons and good women will always be beloved by their parents, teachers, friends, kings, ministers, ascetics, priests, and so forth, guarded by the buddhas, bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, and pratyekbuddhas in the ten directions, and guarded by gods, Māra, Brahmā, humans, and non-humans in the world, which will extinguish all calamities and prevent non-Buddhist theories from being subdued.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，由於般若波羅蜜多至心聽聞乃至供養，得如是等現法勝利。
translation: Because these good men and good women wholeheartedly hear and make offerings to the perfection of wisdom, they'll attain such surpassing benefits in the present life.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等，書寫如是甚深般若波羅蜜多，種種莊嚴置清淨處，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎。
translation: "Suppose good men and good women write such a profound prajñāpāramitā, adorn it in various ways, place it in a pure place, and offer it up in respect and veneration, honoring and praising it.

source_sentence: 時，此三千大千國土及餘十方無邊世界，所有四大王眾天乃至廣果天已發無上菩提心者，常來此處觀禮、讀誦，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，右繞禮拜合掌而去。
translation: At the time, in these 3,000 great thousand lands and in the other 10 directions of the infinite world, the four great guardian gods and even the Vairocana gods who have aroused the unsurpassed mind of enlightenment often come to this place to observe, venerate, recite, make offerings, venerate, praise, bow to their right, put their palms together, and depart.

source_sentence: 諸淨居天亦常來此觀禮、讀誦，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，右繞禮拜合掌而去。
translation: The Pure Land gods also often come here to observe, read, recite, make offerings, revere, honor, and praise them, circumambulate to the right, venerate, and clap their hands together, and depart.

source_sentence: 有大威德諸龍、藥叉，廣說乃至人非人等，亦常來此觀禮、讀誦，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，右繞禮拜合掌而去。
translation: The dragons and yakṣas of great authority, as well as those of extensive teaching and both humans and non-humans, also often come here to observe, recite, make offerings, revere, honor, and praise them, bow right and close their palms in prostration, and depart.

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等應作是念：『今此三千大千國土及餘十方無邊世界一切天、龍，廣說乃至人非人等，常來至此觀禮、讀誦我所書寫甚深般若波羅蜜多，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，右繞禮拜合掌而去，此我則為已設法施。』
translation: Good sons and good women, then, should think, 'Now, when all the gods and dragons of these 3,000 great thousand lands and other infinite worlds in ten directions, as well as humans and nonhumans who have spoken so eloquently, come here often to observe and recite the profound prajñāpāramitā that I've written, make offerings, revere, respect and praise it, bow to my right side, put their palms together, and depart, then I've set up a Dharma gift for them.'

source_sentence: 作是念已歡喜踊躍，令所獲福倍復增長。
translation: Rejoicing and jumping for joy after that thought, it will cause the merits they've gained to grow even more.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，由無邊界天、龍、藥叉、阿素洛等常隨擁護，所住之處人非人等不能損害，唯除宿世定惡業因現在應熟，或轉重惡現世輕受。
translation: These good sons and good women are always accompanied by limitless gods, dragons, yakṣas, asuras, and others, and where they live, humans and non-humans can't harm them except for the causes of bad karma determined in prior lives that are ripening now or that may bring about serious harm that's lightly experienced in the present life.

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，由深般若波羅蜜多大威神力，獲如是等現法勝利。」
translation: Good sons and good women, by virtue of the great authority of the profound prajñāpāramitā, have attained such surpassing benefits in the present life."

source_sentence: 時，天帝釋便白佛言：「是善男子、善女人等，以何驗知有此三千大千國土及餘十方無邊世界天、龍、藥叉、阿素洛等，來至其處觀禮、讀誦彼所書持甚深般若波羅蜜多，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，合掌右繞歡喜護念？」
translation: Tendai then said to the Buddha, "Good sons and good women, what is the verification that there are gods, dragons, yakṣas, asuras, and others from these 3,000 great thousand lands and the other 10 infinite worlds who come to visit them, venerate them, recite the profound prajñāparamitā they've written and uphold, offer support and respect, venerate and praise them, fold their palms, circumambulate them to the right, and rejoice and venerate them?"

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告天帝釋言：「是善男子、善女人等，若見如是甚深般若波羅蜜多所在之處有妙光明，或聞其處異香氛郁，或復聞有微細樂音，當知爾時有大神力威德熾盛諸天、龍等，來至其處觀禮、讀誦彼所書持甚深般若波羅蜜多，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，合掌右繞歡喜護念。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra, "Good sons and good women, if they see such a place where the profound perfection of wisdom is located and there's a wonderful radiance, or if they hear a strange fragrance or a subtle, pleasant sound, they should know that at the time there are gods and dragons of great supernormal powers and blazing virtue who come to that place, venerate it, recite the profound perfection of wisdom that they've written and held, offer support and respect, praise it, put their palms together, circumambulate it to the right, and rejoice and venerate it.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，修鮮淨行嚴麗其處，至心供養甚深般若波羅蜜多，當知爾時有大神力威德熾盛諸天、龍等來至其處，觀禮、讀誦彼所書持甚深般若波羅蜜多，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，合掌右繞歡喜護念。
translation: "Good sons and good women who cultivate a refined and pure practice, adorn their places, and wholeheartedly make offerings to the profound perfection of wisdom should know that at the time, gods and dragons of great supernormal powers and blazing virtue will come to them, venerate them, recite the profound perfection of wisdom they've written and held, offer their respects, honor, and praise them, fold their palms, circumambulate them to the right, and rejoice and venerate them.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 隨有如是具大神力威德熾盛諸天、龍等來至其處，此中所有惡鬼、邪神驚怖退散無敢住者。
translation: Whenever such gods and dragons with great supernormal powers and blazing authority come to them, all the evil spirits and guardian spirits there become frightened and retreat, and none of them dare to stay.

source_sentence: 由此因緣，是善男子、善女人等，心便廣大起淨勝解，所修善業倍復增明，諸有所為皆無障礙。
translation: As a result, these good sons and good women will widely arouse a pure resolve in their minds, and the good actions they cultivate will become doubly insightful, making all their actions unobstructed.

source_sentence: 以是故，憍尸迦！
translation: Therefore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 甚深般若波羅蜜多隨所在處，應當周匝除去糞穢，掃拭塗治香水散灑，敷設寶座而安置之，燒香散花而為供養。
translation: The profound prajñāpāramitā should be placed wherever it's found, soiled, soaped, perfumed, scattered, placed on a jeweled pedestal, and scattered with flowers and incense as an offering.

source_sentence: 「復次，憍尸迦！
translation: "Furthermore, Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，若能如是供養恭敬、尊重讚歎甚深般若波羅蜜多，決定當得身心無倦、身心安樂、身心調柔、身心輕利。
translation: "Good men and good women, if they thus make offerings, honor, respect, and praise the profound perfection of wisdom, they will surely attain tirelessness of body and mind, physical and mental well-being, mental and physical gentleness, and physical and mental well-being.

source_sentence: 繫心般若波羅蜜多，夜寢息時無諸惡夢，唯得善夢，謂見如來、應、正等覺身真金色相好莊嚴，放大光明普照一切，聲聞、菩薩恭敬圍繞，身處眾中聞佛為說布施等六波羅蜜多及餘善根相應法義。
translation: When they are bound up in the perfection of wisdom, they'll have no bad dreams when they sleep at night but only good dreams, meaning they see the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One's body adorned with genuine gold features and an outsized radiance that shines everywhere, surrounded by the respect of śrāvakas and bodhisattvas, and they'll be among the many people who hear the Buddha teach the Dharma meaning associated with the six perfections of generosity and other good roots.

source_sentence: 或於夢中見菩提樹，其量高廣眾寶莊嚴，有大菩薩往詣樹下，結跏趺坐證得無上正等菩提，轉妙法輪度有情眾。
translation: Or in a dream, they see a bodhi tree that's so large and spacious that it's adorned with treasures, and a great bodhisattva goes up to the base of the tree, sits cross-legged, realizes unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and turns the wonderful wheel of the Dharma to save sentient beings.

source_sentence: 或於夢中見有無量無數菩薩論義決擇種種法義。
translation: Sometimes in a dream, I see measureless and countless bodhisattvas discussing and discerning the various meanings of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 或於夢中見有無量無數菩薩修行六種波羅蜜多，成熟有情、嚴淨佛土，迴向攝受一切智智。
translation: Or in a dream, they see measureless and countless bodhisattvas cultivating the six perfections, ripening sentient beings, adorning and purifying the Buddha's land, and dedicating themselves to the wisdom of all knowables.

source_sentence: 或於夢中見十方界各有無量那庾多佛，亦聞其聲，謂某世界有某如來、應、正等覺若干百千聲聞、菩薩恭敬圍繞說如是法。
translation: In a dream, they see measureless Nayuta buddhas in each of the ten directions and hear their voice, which says that in a certain world there's a certain Tathāgata, Arhat, or Fully Awakened One, and that there are hundreds of thousands of śrāvakas and bodhisattvas who respectfully surround them and preach such a teaching.

source_sentence: 或於夢中見十方界各有無量那庾多佛入般涅槃，彼一一佛般涅槃後，各有施主為供養佛設利羅故，以妙七寶各起無量大窣堵波，復於一一窣堵波所，各持無量上妙花鬘乃至燈明，經無量劫供養恭敬、尊重讚歎。
translation: In a dream, they might see measureless Nayuta buddhas in each of the ten directions enter parinirvāṇa, and after each of those buddhas' parinirvāṇa, each donor raises a measureless number of large stūpas with seven wonderful treasures in order to support the Buddha's śarīra, and at each of those stūpas, they each carry measureless flowers, jewelry, and lamps, which they worship, honor, respect, and praise for measureless eons.

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等見如是類諸善夢相，若睡若覺身心安樂。
translation: "When good sons and good women see these kinds of characteristics of good dreams, they are comfortable in body and mind whether they are asleep or awake.

source_sentence: 諸天神等益其精氣，令彼自覺身體輕便，由此因緣，不多貪著飲食、醫藥、衣服、臥具，於四供養其心輕微，如瑜伽師入勝妙定，由彼定力滋潤身心，從定出已雖遇美膳而心輕微，此亦如是。
translation: As a result, they don't crave more food, medicine, clothing, or bedding, and their minds are light when it comes to these four offerings. Like a yogi who enters excellent, wonderful concentration and lets the power of that concentration nourish his body and mind, this is likewise when he emerges from concentration and encounters a nice meal but his mind is light.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 是善男子、善女人等，由此三千大千國土及餘十方無邊世界諸佛、菩薩、獨覺、聲聞、天、龍、藥叉、阿素洛等慈悲護念，以妙精氣冥澍身心，令其志勇體充盛故。
translation: Good sons and good women, this is because the buddhas, bodhisattvas, solitary realizers, śrāvakas, gods, dragons, yakṣas, asuras, and others in the 3,000 great thousand lands and the other 10 directions and infinite worlds compassionately guard and watch over them, using their wonderful energy to calm their bodies and minds and make their aspirations and bodies flourish.

source_sentence: 「憍尸迦！
translation: "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等欲得如是現法勝利，於深般若波羅蜜多，應常聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，廣為有情宣說開示。
translation: "If good men and good women want to attain the surpassing benefit of such a manifestation, they should always hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, correctly contemplate, and extensively explain and reveal the profound perfection of wisdom for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 憍尸迦！
translation: Kauśika!

source_sentence: 若善男子、善女人等，雖於般若波羅蜜多，不能聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟，廣為有情宣說開示，而為正法久住世間，利樂有情不滅沒故，書寫如是甚深般若波羅蜜多，眾寶嚴飾，復持無量上妙花鬘乃至燈明，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎，亦得如前所說勝利。
translation: "If good sons and good women who are unable to hear, retain, recite, diligently cultivate, and correctly contemplate the prajñāpāramitā, nevertheless write such a profound prajñāpāramitā, adorn it with numerous treasures, carry measureless flowers and even lamps, make offerings, respect, and praise it for the sake of the long abiding of the right teaching and the benefit of sentient beings who won't perish, they'll also attain the benefits described above.

source_sentence: 大般若波羅蜜多經卷第五百五十七
translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra, Vol. 557
